intro: Scrofella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmately compound leaves. The flowers are typically greenish-yellow with five sepals and no petals, and they are arranged in racemose inflorescences. Scrofella species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. These plants are often found in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
